refsection.title: Note
refsection.para: Some operating systems come with a chroot command that does not chain, but that instead spawns its target as a child process. This command does not fork a child process, and so is suitable for use in supervised command chains run under control of a dæmon supervisor.

refsection.title: Description
refsection.para: chroot is a chain-loading utility that changes its current root to directory and then chain loads to next-prog with the execvp3 function.
next-prog may contain its own command line options, which chroot will ignore.
The functionality of the GNU chroot command can be achieved by combining this command with setuidgid1.

refsection.title: Security
refsection.para: On most systems, only the superuser is permitted to execute the underlying system call.
